description: {"blocks":[{"key":"7eqkj","text":"This protocol details the procedure of determination of edits in CRISPR-edited cell lines by sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"22of5","text":"Buffers and reagents:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ff5dj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a35ti","text":"Zymo genomic DNA isolation kit (D3025)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8u8gt","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"au2ut","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"84hf4","text":"  and  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":6,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2ff0h","text":"NEB 5-alpha Competent E. coli (NEB #C2987).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":2684,"mol_weight":0,"name":"QIAquick PCR Purification Kit","linfor":"","url":"https://www.qiagen.com/us/shop/sample-technologies/dna-sample-technologies/dna-cleanup/qiaquick-pcr-purification-kit","sku":"28104","cas_number":"","rrid":"","public":1,"can_edit":0,"guid":"37F652F0131E11ED8F6E3F1DB1A375B3","in_steps":null,"vendor":{"id":25,"name":"Qiagen","link":"https://www.qiagen.com/us/products/","image":{"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"}}}},"1":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":1001,"mol_weight":0,"name":"T4 DNA Ligase - 20,000 units","linfor":"","url":"https://www.neb.com/M0202","sku":"M0202S","cas_number":"","rrid":"","public":1,"can_edit":0,"guid":"F44829B0131E11ED8F6E3F1DB1A375B3","in_steps":null,"vendor":{"id":2,"name":"New England Biolabs","link":"https://www.neb.com/","image":{"source":"/img/vendors/2.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/2.png"}}}},"2":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":1864,"mol_weight":0,"name":"BamHI-HF - 10,000 units","linfor":"","url":"https://www.neb.com/R3136","sku":"R3136S","cas_number":"","rrid":"","public":1,"can_edit":0,"guid":"0D8494E0131F11ED8F6E3F1DB1A375B3","in_steps":null,"vendor":{"id":2,"name":"New England Biolabs","link":"https://www.neb.com/","image":{"source":"/img/vendors/2.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/2.png"}}}},"3":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":1848,"mol_weight":0,"name":"HindIII-HF - 10,000 units","linfor":"","url":"https://www.neb.com/R3104","sku":"R3104S","cas_number":"","rrid":"","public":1,"can_edit":0,"guid":"1F757A20131F11ED8F6E3F1DB1A375B3","in_steps":null,"vendor":{"id":2,"name":"New England Biolabs","link":"https://www.neb.com/","image":{"source":"/img/vendors/2.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/2.png"}}}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bk0s4","text":"Harvest the CRISPR-edited cells that need to be sequenced and the control parental cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3lqfn","text":"Amplify the region of interest (CRISPR-target region) via PCR using primers obtained when designing CRISPR construct.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6p60a","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"kcd6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"amoem","text":" See “Generation of CRISPR constructs” protocol.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ch733","text":"Run a 1 % DNA agarose gel to check if the PCR has worked.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f584r","text":"If PCR products are present, clean them up with Qiagen PCR cleanup kit.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6otvu","text":"Send the cleaned-up PCR products to sequencing service with a sequencing primer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cs88b","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8911s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4r3jq","text":" I normally choose a 15 bp DNA sequence (less than 60 % of GC content) within the region of interest at least 100 bp away from CRIPR target site as the sequencing primer.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7vtci","text":"Analyze the sequencing data using this website https://ice.synthego.com/#/.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":47,"length":27}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"C6B12256131F11EDB1220A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://ice.synthego.com/#"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"65cbq","text":"Sometimes, if the sequencing service provider(s) have trouble sequence the PCR products, it might be worth trying to clone these PCR products into a small non-expression plasmid such as pGEM4Z prior to sequencing:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d0sm8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"arh3j","text":"Incorporate BamHI site (GCGCGGATCC; BamHI site is highlighted in grey, the rest is overhang) and HindIII site (GCGCAAGCTT; HindIII site is highlighted in green, the rest is overhang) into the primers mentioned in step 3.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":28,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":115,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5jrim","text":"Amplify the region of interest from genomic DNA isolated from the CRISPR-edited cells with these primers via PCR.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3eosq","text":"Cut the amplified PCR products and pGEM4Z with BamHI and HindIII.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8p1l","text":"Clean up the cut PCR products and pGEM4Z with Qiagen PCR cleanup kit.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2p6bq","text":"Ligate the PCR products and pGEM4Z together using T4 DNA ligase.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"er5u3","text":"Transform the ligated product mix into E. coli competent cells and plate on an Ampicillin agar plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dif4q","text":"Screen for colonies with pGEM4Z ligated with the PCR products.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7go3u","text":"Send them for sequencing with M13 forward or reverse primer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"euili","text":"Align the sequencing data with the reference sequence to determine the edits.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8jusg","text":"Isolate genomic DNA using according to manufacturer’s instructions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Determination of edits in CRISPR-edited cell lines by sequencing
